titleStmt.title: GEntle Reader, I entreate thee correct these faults (being the most materiall) with thy pen.

publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: GEntle Reader, I entreate thee correct these faults (being the most materiall) with thy pen.

monogr.title: Hezekiah's recovery. Or, A sermon, shevving what use Hezekiah did, and all should make of their deliverance from sickenesse. First preached, and now published by Robert Harris, pastor of Hanwell
monogr.author: Harris, Robert

div.head: GEntle Reader, I entreate thee correct these faults (being the most materiall) with thy pen.
div.p: In the Epist. pag. 1. l. 8. read our. p. 4. l. 9. for here r. fure. ib. in marg. r. servi. In the Serm. p. 16. l. 23. r. no more. p. 22. marg. r. Videatur. p. 26 l. 11. r. Noble Hezekiah. p. 29. marg. l 8. & to. r. quod. p. 33. l. 11. r. finnefull povertie. p. 41. marg r. Tacuimus. p. 42. marg. for vol. r. Reg. p. 43. l. 29. r. much.
